1 #include <stdio.h>
  2 #include <stdlib.h>
  3 #include <stdbool.h>
  4 #include <time.h>
  5 #include "mpi.h"
  6 
  7 #ifndef INF
  8 #define INF 999999
  9 #endif
 10 
 11 
 12 // printing a matrix; for debugging
 13 void printMatrix(int **matrix, int dim){
 14     int i, j;
 15     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
 16         for (j = 0; j < dim; j++){
 17                 printf("%d\t", matrix[i][j]);
 18         }
 19         printf("\n"); // linebreak for new row
 20     }
 21     return;
 22 }
 23 
 24 // printing a vector; for debugging
 25 void printVector(int *vector, int dim){
 26     int i;
 27     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
 28         printf("%d\t", vector[i]);
 29     }
 30     printf("\n");
 31     return;
 32 }
 33 
 34 
 35 void reverseArray(int *arr, int start, int end){ 
 36     int temp; 
 37     while (start < end){ 
 38         temp = arr[start];    
 39         arr[start] = arr[end]; 
 40         arr[end] = temp; 
 41         start++; 
 42         end--; 
 43     }
 44     return;    
 45 }
 46 
 47 
 48 void printPath(int i, int start, int dimPath, int *parent, int *distance){
 49     int j, count, temp, path[dimPath];
 50 
 51     // initialize path array with no connections
 52     for (j = 0; j < dimPath; j++){
 53         path[j] = INF;
 54     }
 55 
 56     // removes "d(0-0) = 0    path: 0" from print output
 57     if (i != start){
 58         temp = distance[i];
 59         printf("d(%d-%d) = %d\t\tpath: ", start, i, temp);
 60 
 61         // catching problem of missing path between nodes, happens for small values of dim
 62         if (temp != INF){
 63             j = i;
 64 
 65             // going backwards through parents until start is reached
 66             count = 0;
 67             while(j != start) {
 68                 j = parent[j];
 69                 path[count] = j;
 70                 count++;
 71             }
 72 
 73             // reversing path for nicer printing (start -> ... -> end)
 74             reverseArray(path, 0, dimPath - 1); 
 75 
 76             // printing the path and resetting path array
 77             for (j = 0; j < dimPath; j++){
 78                 temp = path[j];
 79                 if (temp != INF){
 80                     printf("%d -> ", temp);
 81                 }
 82                 path[j] = INF;
 83             }
 84             printf("%d", i); // end node
 85         }
 86         else {
 87             printf("does not exist.");
 88         }
 89     }
 90     return;
 91 }
 92 
 93 
 94 // Dijkstra's algorithm
 95 void dijkstra(int **graph, int dim, int start, int rank, int size, double *time_dijkstra_start, double *time_dijkstra_end){
 96     int i, j, k, minDistance, dimPath = 100, next = 1, chunksize, rest, begin, end;
 97     int *recv_counts = NULL, *recv_displs = NULL;
 98     int global_min[2], local_min[2];
 99     int full_dist[dim], full_parent[dim], sub_dist[dim], sub_parent[dim];
100     bool visited[dim];
101 
102     // borders for MPI parallelization of arrays 
103     chunksize = dim / size; // array size for each processor; int division
104     begin = rank * chunksize; // start index of array in loop
105     end = begin + chunksize - 1; // end index of array in loop
106 
107     // if #nodes is not divisible by #procs; remainder to last proc (imbalance)
108     rest = dim % size;
109     if (rank == size - 1){
110         if (rest){
111             chunksize += rest;            
112             end += rest;
113         }
114     }
115 
116     // loop 1: init distance vector; distances from start to adjescent nodes 
117     for (i = begin; i <= end; i++){
118         sub_dist[i - begin] = graph[start][i];
119     }
120     /* set distance from start node to itself to zero; since the code works
121     with parts of the full array, only node 0 will definitely be in the part
122     assigned to rank 0, i.e. start nodes != 0 may be located in sub arrays of 
123     other ranks; hence, the code will not work for other start nodes */
124     if (rank == 0){
125         sub_dist[start] = 0; 
126     }
127 
128     // loop 1': init parent node array; no exisiting parents yet
129     for (i = 0; i < chunksize; i++){
130         sub_parent[i] = 0;
131     }
132 
133     // loop 1'': init status array; processed nodes are flagged with true 
134     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
135         visited[i] = false; 
136     }
137     visited[start] = true; // not necessary, since zero is minDistance anyway; saves a bit of time as it circumvents the second if statement in loop 3 
138 
139 
140 
141     // start time for parallel part of dijkstra algorithm
142     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
143     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
144     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
145     *time_dijkstra_start = MPI_Wtime(); 
146 
147     // loop 2: main part of algorithm; iterating over number of nodes
148     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
149         local_min[0] = INF; // initializing minimum distance in every iteration
150 
151         /* loop 3: finding node with lowest distance value in distance vector
152         (if node was not already visited); already processed nodes are
153         excluded according to their visited status (true) */ 
154         for (j = 0; j < chunksize ; j++){
155             if (!visited[j + begin]){
156                 if (sub_dist[j] < local_min[0]){
157                     local_min[0] = sub_dist[j]; // minimal distance value
158                     local_min[1] = j + begin; // index of the closest node
159                 }
160             }
161         }
162 
163 
164         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
165         // MPI part 1: start
166 
167         // find global minimum 
168         if (rank != 0){
169             //printf("rank %d: with min = %d and next = %d \n", rank, local_min[0], local_min[1]);
170             // slaves send local minimum to the master
171             MPI_Send(local_min, 2, MPI_INT, 0, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
172         }
173         else {
174             //printf("rank %d: with min = %d and next = %d \n", rank, local_min[0], local_min[1]);
175             // initialize global minimum with local min of master
176             global_min[0] = local_min[0];
177             global_min[1] = local_min[1];
178 
179             // checking for smaller values from slaves and updating
180             for (j = 1; j < size; j++){
181                 MPI_Recv(local_min, 2, MPI_INT, j, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
182                 if (local_min[0] < global_min[0]){
183                     global_min[0] = local_min[0];
184                     global_min[1] = local_min[1];
185                 }
186             }
187         }
188 
189         // distribute the global minimum back to all procs
190         if (rank == 0){
191             for (j = 1; j < size; j++){
192                 MPI_Send(global_min, 2, MPI_INT, j, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
193             }
194         }
195         else {
196             MPI_Recv(global_min, 2, MPI_INT, 0, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
197         }
198 
199         minDistance = global_min[0];
200         next = global_min[1];
201 
202         // MPI part 1: end
203         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
204 
205 
206         /* closest node in current distance list is found and thus given a
207         processed flag, which will leave it untouched in further iterations */
208         visited[next] = true;
209 
210         /* loop 4: updating the distance vector with distances from next node 
211         (graph[next][j]) -> including new connections (replacing INF) and
212         shorter indirect paths; by adding the minDistance we keep track of the 
213         distance already travelled w.r.t the start node; already processed
214         nodes must again be excluded */
215         for (j = 0; j < chunksize; j++){
216             if (!visited[j + begin]){
217                 if (minDistance + graph[next][j + begin] < sub_dist[j]){
218                     sub_dist[j] = minDistance + graph[next][j + begin];
219                     sub_parent[j] = next;
220                 }
221             }
222         }
223     }
224 
225 
226     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
227     // MPI part 2: start
228 
229     // initialize array for start index of concatenation (recv_displs) and chunksizes (recv_counts); preparation for MPI_Gatherv
230     if (rank == 0){
231         recv_displs = (int *) malloc(size * sizeof(int));
232         recv_counts = (int *) malloc(size * sizeof(int));
233     }
234 
235     // gather chunksizes in array recv_counts for root
236     MPI_Gather(&chunksize, 1, MPI_INT, recv_counts, 1, MPI_INT, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
237 
238     // build recv_displs array with chunksizes from recv_counts
239     if (rank == 0){
240         recv_displs[0] = 0;
241         for (i = 1; i < size; i++){
242             recv_displs[i] = recv_displs[i - 1] + recv_counts[i - 1];
243         }
244     }
245 
246     // concatenate sub arrays
247     MPI_Gatherv(sub_dist, chunksize, MPI_INT, full_dist, recv_counts, recv_displs, MPI_INT, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
248     MPI_Gatherv(sub_parent, chunksize, MPI_INT, full_parent, recv_counts, recv_displs, MPI_INT, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
249 
250     // MPI part 2: end
251     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
252 
253 
254     // time for parallel part of dijkstra algorithm
255     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
256     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
257     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
258     *time_dijkstra_end = MPI_Wtime();
259 
260 
261 
262     // printing; only for small values of dim (legibility in terminal, w=160)
263     if (rank == 0){
264         if (dim < 21){
265             printf("\n");
266             printf("Adjacency matrix:\n-----------------\n");
267             printMatrix(graph, dim);
268             printf("\n\nPaths:\n------");
269             for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
270                 printPath(i, start, dimPath, full_parent, full_dist);
271                 printf("\n");
272             }
273         }
274         // only print path from start to last node
275         else {
276             printf("\nPath (start to last):\n---------------------\n");
277             printPath(dim - 1, start, dimPath, full_parent, full_dist);
278         }
279         printf("\n");
280     }
281     
282     free(recv_counts);
283     free(recv_displs);
284 
285     return;
286 }
287 
288 
289 int main(int argc, char *argv[]){
290     int i, j, k, dim, temp, rank, size;
291     double start_time, end_time, time_init, time_random, time_dijkstra_start, time_dijkstra_end;
292 
293     // stuff for random numbers; seeding is necessary for true randomness
294     int randMin = 0, randMax;
295     //srand(time(NULL)); // comment out for comparability
296 
297     // MPI setup
298     MPI_Init(&argc, &argv);
299     MPI_Comm_size(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &size);
300     MPI_Comm_rank(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &rank);
301     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
302     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
303     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
304     start_time = MPI_Wtime();
305 
306     if (rank == 0){
307         printf("Number of processors: %d\n\n", size);
308     }
309 
310 
311     // allowing to set dimension with one optional command line argument 
312     if (argc != 2){ // really just one argument; default
313         dim = 10000;
314     }
315     else {
316         dim = atoi(argv[1]); // str2int (from stdlib.h)
317     }
318     if (dim > 100){
319         randMax = dim / 10; // dynamic value for longer paths
320     }
321     else {
322         randMax = 10;
323     }
324 
325 
326     // memory allocation for random matrix of dimension <dim>
327     int **randomGraph = (int **)malloc(dim * sizeof(int*));
328     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
329         randomGraph[i] = (int *)malloc(dim * sizeof(int));
330     }
331 
332     /* generate matrix of dimension <dim> depicting the adjacency matrix of a
333     (bi)directed graph, which requires a symmetric matrix;
334     initialized with unconnected nodes (INF), i < j gets a triangular matrix
335     without the diagonal (remains INF), upper and lower triangular matrix are
336     filled with the same random values if they are nonzero */
337     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
338         for (j = 0; j < dim; j++){
339             randomGraph[i][j] = INF;
340         }
341     }
342 
343     // time for init
344     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
345     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
346     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
347     time_init = MPI_Wtime();
348 
349     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
350         for (j = 0; j < i; j++){ // j < i avoids additional if statement
351             temp = randMin + rand() / (RAND_MAX / (randMax - randMin + 1) + 1);
352             if (temp != 0){
353                 randomGraph[i][j] = temp;
354                 randomGraph[j][i] = temp;
355             }
356         }
357     }
358 
359     // time for creating the random graph
360     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
361     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
362     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
363     time_random = MPI_Wtime();
364 
365 
366     // calling Dijkstra's algorithm
367     dijkstra(randomGraph, dim, 0, rank, size, &time_dijkstra_start, &time_dijkstra_end);
368 
369 
370     // memory deallocation for (2D) arrays
371     for (i = 0; i < dim; i++){
372         free(randomGraph[i]);
373     }
374     free(randomGraph);
375 
376     // total time
377     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
378     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
379     MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
380     end_time = MPI_Wtime();
381 
382     // timings
383     if (rank == 0){
384         printf("\n\nTimings:\n--------\n");
385         printf("Setup of graph (init):\t\t%.3lfs\n", time_init - start_time);
386         printf("Setup of graph (random):\t%.3lfs\n", time_random - time_init);
387         printf("Dijkstra (parallel):\t\t%.3lfs\n", time_dijkstra_end - time_dijkstra_start);
388         printf("Total time:\t\t\t%.3lfs\n", end_time - start_time);
389         printf("\n");
390     }
391 
392     MPI_Finalize();
393 
394     return 0;
395 }
396 
397 
398 /*
399 compiling:
400 ----------
401 module add openmpi/gcc/9.1.0/3.1.4
402 mpicc random.c -o random.exe
403 
404 
405 execution:
406 ----------
407 ./random.exe <number of nodes/vertices>
408 (one command line argument is allowed, otherwise defaults are applied)
409 
410 
411 fixed problems:
412 ---------------
413 "next" must be initialized to 1 in order to avoid segmentation fault: If all
414 nodes are unconnected (all entries in matrix are INF), no closest node in is
415 found in loop 3. Therefore "next" is not given any value and defaults to 
416 32766, which is problematic for the following array indexing (graph[next][j]);
417 this usually just happens for graph sizes of 2 or 3
418 
419 
420 utility for debugging:
421 ----------------------
422 printf("distance:\t");
423 printVector(distance, dim);
424 printf("parent:\t\t");
425 printVector(parent, dim);
426 */
